art.title: CSS art
art.intro: This is a collection of CSS graphics I have created. Feel free to use them on your projects. Read more about CSS art on

heart.title: Heart
heart.description: Heart looks simple, but it's a bit more complex than it seems. You can use the :before and :after pseudo-elements to create the two halves of the heart. The idea is to create two rectangles, rotate them to overlap with each other, and then round the corners to create the illusion of a heart shape. Maybe the most complex part is to get the heart to stay inside the borders of the outside div while keeping the shape.

smiley.title: Smiley
smiley.description: Smiley face is a fun and simple graphic to create, and also easy to modify for your liking. First you create the face, which is just a yellow circle. Then you add the eyes, which are two smaller circles. The mouth is a bit more complex, but you can create it by using a rectangle with rounded corners. Optionally add teeth, which are also a rectangle with rounded corners.

peace.title: Peace sign
peace.description: Peace sign is very straightforward to create. You can use the border property to create the circle, and then create three thin rectangles to form the lines.

moon.title: Moon
moon.description1: Moon is one of the simplest CSS graphics to create. You can use the
moon.description2: property to create the different moon phases.

fullMoon.title: Full moon
fullMoon.description: Full moon is really simple, since it's just a circle. You can make it a little more interesting by adding a couple craters, which are darker circles of varying sizes and positions.

quarterMoon.title: Third quarter moon
quarterMoon.description: Quarter moon, or half moon, is a little different but still simple. You can't just use a single box-shadow to create it. One option is to create a rectangle and round its two corners with border-radius.
